column1: Work has been megabusy just lately and I have discovered a new love for painting things and finally (9 years alter) reached the point where I can't deal with all the not done things in my house that we were gonna do as soon as we moved in, and two small children and let's be honest here disappointment in Age of Ultron and a lack of anything else I feel fannish about right now

But it is the most wonderful time of the year, and I really want to try and finish last year's NaNo (which, I know, I know not really the done thing but see above re no time for anything including even the very rudimentary planning I do).
So yeah, just popping my head out of my oubliette to say I'm going to try and be stupid busy doing NaNo for the next month.

event,"Had an awesome time. Met awesome people and watched awesome vids. Lots of fun discussion. Didn't really get my sleep cycle into US mode at all so I missed out on the disco duck this time around :-(

Thought-provoking panel on dubcon as an allegory of late stage capitalism. No really. I've been thinking about it ever since and about how, at least the stuff I write, is about making the least-worst choice in an imperfect system in which the character or characters have no power.
Interesting stuff in it about how writing consent issues onto male bodies makes them visible in a way that they may not be when women are subject to them.
Probably my favourite of all the panels I attended. Although they were all good.

It was basically just awesome to spend some time among fannish people, who were perfectly happy to talk for half an hour on the themes in cap 2, instead of falling asleep half an hour into the movie (not that I'm looking at anyone in particular, oh husband of mine!!).

I went to the national air and space museum, which was cool, and the museum of American history. I was gonna go to the spy museum but instead I went out for lunch with gblvr and ktnb which was even cooler.
And now I am waiting for my flight home. Looking forward to seeing my little ones but sad that the con is over.
Ugh and now I discover that my flight is delayed over two hours. Fml
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/67721.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"<lj-cut text=""cut for spoilers and general wtfuckery. Not squee"">

I just...okay, the whole thing was overwrought and far too impressed with its own cleverness and I dn't so much want to, what was it, melt the glacier of Sherlock as punch him in the face and teach him some fucking human decency, but what really got me was John, at work.

or at 'work' because it seemed to me that Mary had already done more than half of his work before she let each patient into the room, what with the way she introduced each one with a diagnosis (something that has been frowned upon for at least 15 years) so what were they actually paying him for? The NHS doesn't have the resources to double up clinicians on every case of thrush that wanders into a surgery, and it couldn't afford the lawsuits from either allowing a non-clinician to make diagnoses or the 'hilarious' assault on a patient.
Is John still supposed to be locumming? Because I kinda doubt he'll be asked back to that practice.</lj-cut>
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/66871.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."
event,"I thought the boys went back to school today, but it is tomorrow. There go my plans for watching a load of rubbish on tv while drinking tea and revelling in the peace and quiet.

event,"Why can't I write an Avengers story that doesn't turn into a Clint and Steve: awkward BFFs lately?
Why is it that when ever I think I have an idea for a h/c bingo prompt it always starts off being about that particular h/c scenario and then turns into Steve's crippling loneliness?
Which, ouch, makes them sound a lot more angsty and overegged than they hopefully are, but hey, whatever, I'm whining.

Don't think I'm ever going to get caught up with my nano wordcount, which means I totally could have slacked off for the first two weeks and watched terrible TV and rewatched Captain America eleventy billion times.

column2: forced to participate in illegal / hurtful activity

column1: WILD CARD
And when I look at it, all I can see is BuckyBarnes BuckyBarnes BuckyBarnes and Steeeeeeeeeeeeve.

So, I think I have ticked off forced to participate in hurtful activity. I have ideas for blood loss (Steeeeve), and poisoning (Clint, with Clint and Steeeve friendship because fml that's why what's it to you anyway?), but I started writing something that was supposed to be for PTSD and has veered off into homesickness Steve feels (Steve/Coulson, maybe, if I can get them past being sad).

But honestly, look at the far right vertical. It's just got The Winter Soldier written all over it, no? (I really wanna write Bucky whores himself out to pay for pre-serum Steve's medical needs too, or no, not want to write - want to have written)
I'm still plugging away at all the fics from my stupid first round trope bingo card too, not a single one of which is showing any signs of being under 30k.

I am mostly moaning, but if anyone wants to throw a prompt/suggestion/idea/anything my way, I'll be grateful. Can't promise to write it and certainly can't promise to write it quickly, because see above re: ridiculously out of hand length of stories.

So, long shot I know, but does anyone fancy collaborating with me? Partly because I'm far less likely to punk out if I'm not only letting myself down, but also because it would be totally amazing to have extreme artwork or podficcage to go with the story...although my mind boggles at the idea of podficcing 100k.

event,"There's no chance of me posting every day at the moment, but when the kids go back to school I might try it.

Why is it that having two small children is so much more than twice the work of having one small child? I'm hoping as they get older they will each start to entertain the other, but I've been hoping that for 18 months already and they mostly just seem to wind each other up endlessly.

Never mind. School starts in 2 weeks. How it is possible that F is going to school already is beyond me, but that doesn't mean I'm not already planning to see if I can squeeze his baby brother into his school bag as a stowaway.
And before that we are going to see my sister in Madrid, and taking my mum, which is going to be stressful but fun.
And who knows, maybe after all that I can get myself back on the UFYH wagon and unearth my desk from beneath the accumulated detritus of the summer holidays.
I'm not going to make the deadline for rough drafts for the marvel bigbang. Not without carving whichever story I go for brutally.
I miss having writing time, and time to make and maintain fannish friendships :-(
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/64206.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"So, once again I completely failed at a bingo comm. trope_bingo this time, but at least this time I could have got a bingo if it weren't for my accursed inability to write a) anything short b) in my sleep or c) whilst also working/looking after children/doing other apparently important stuff like eating and sleeping and basic grooming functions.
OTOH, I do have, already >100k of fic for my card, it's just spread out over a whole load of different fics. Also I need to learn how to gifset, which...technologically gifted I am not.

So, I am sad that I cannot request another card for this year, but it's probably a good thing, since I don't think a single one of the fics I am writing for the last card are going to come in under 30k.
I am going to complete at least one of these benighted things for the next amnesty period, so help me.
I may also have signed up for kink_bingo, because fallow year, and open to everyone, even hopeless cases like me.

event,"Heh, so I woke up this morning in an anxious state because I'd had a really real-seeming dream that I'd posted this horrendously rapemongous fic to Ao3 and forgotten to tag it for noncon.

So I frantically checked my account and found that no, the last thing I posted was, in fact, the last thing I finished, a totally G-rated bit of Christmas as fluff as one can get while dealing with the Avengers' collective ghastly childhoods.
It's not even like I ever write stuff like I had in my dream.
Oh brain, what are you like?

event,"NaNo is going along nicely. I am about 2k behind target for today which is totally not enough to send me into the spiral of 'omgomgomg so behind I'll never catch up let's go watch TV instead'. I am having so much fun torturing Clint and Phil.

I am having less fun with the thought that I am at 32k and maybe 1/3 to 1/2 of the way in to this fic, and I am absolutely not thinking at all about the fact that I usually underestimate word count even when I think I am being supercautious.

I also signed up for the Clint/Coulson feelstide holiday fest, and am writing that one when I need a rest from the NaNo. The minimum requirement is 500 words, and I have already breezed past that. I am in awe of people who can write short stories. In. awe.

event,"<lj user=""marvel-bang""> starts posting tomorrow. My posting date is next Sunday, and I am, for probably the first time ever, actually completely ready to go.

I've also seen the mix that earlofcardigans has made for it and it is awesome. At least two of the songs have made it straight on to my writing Clint/Phil playlist - or, you know, thinking about writing Clint/Phil playlist because I prefer to write in silence - and there's a few more working their way there.

In other fabulous news about this challenge, one of the stories I am most looking forward to: hoosierbitch and arsenicjade's cowrite, is posting on the last day before NaNo, when I will be totally within my rights to curl up with it's practically guaranteed delicious hurty comfortness.
So all in all, everything is good in casspeachland :-)

event,"I haven't posted in forever because I keep thinking oh no wait, I'll post after that thing and then the next thing and then the next. Ah procrastination, my very best friend.
So lots of awesome stuff has been going on lately.

1) I went back to work after my maternity leave ended which, actually it feels pretty good to wear clothes that don't smell of milk-sick and talk about things that aren't nappies and developmental milestones, although I miss both my boys like crazy when I'm at work. What was awesome though, was discovering I had accrued a whole load of leave with nowhere to take it unless I took November off.
2) so I am taking November off to NaNo like a loon :-)

3) I have decided to stop the annual self-flagellation exercise that is trying to write original fic for NaNo like I don't already have a job I love. Instead I will be writing a Losers/Avengers/Bourne Legacy AU crossover, and it is fair to say I am so excited about it I could dance. I have been spamming my longsuffering wriitng partner montanaharper about it since the idea first occurred to me and she failed (as she so often does) to even attempt to dissuade me.

I am casspeach on NaNo too. Feel free to friend me there but I am pretty hardcore about only messing about on the site when I have hit my wordcount so I'm usually locked out of NaNo along with everything else while I stare at a blinking cursor.
I'm totally stealing the originating premise for the fic from an anonymous prompt on <lj user=""cc-feelsmeme""> so I kind of hope the prompter doesn't mind.

4) Speaking of running away with anonymous prompts, my <lj user=""marvel-bang""> fic is done and betad and submitted. I can't wait to see what my mixer comes up with for it, and I really can't wait to read all the other fics.
after I make my NaNo word count, of course!

5) also awesome? Connotations. I am so sad it was the last one, because I finally got up the nerve to suggest and mod panels and the whole thing was enormous fun. Although I shudder to consider the amount of work and organisation that must go into running a con, and doing so cheerfully and without ever seeming remotely stressed. So I totally get why it's being wrapped up, and why not go out on a high? Highlight of the con for me? Jeremy Renner's delightful behind all over the place, a couple of which I may have appropriated, along with a photo of Clark Gregg looking like he was at a photoshoot for my NaNo.
Yes I am obsessed with my NaNo this year. But that is because it is going to be awesome!
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/61316.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"And I don't think it reduces comments, at least in terms of my giving of comments. When I hit a new fandom with lots of stories already in it I am mega bad at leaving comments because I just want to read alllllll the fic.
So, I've been trying to be good and leave kudos at the very least.

But I'm starting to think there should be a keysmash button as well. Like kudos is for 'I liked this but don't really have anything else to say' and keysmash for 'I loved this so much I cannot even be coherent about it omgomgomg I wish I'd never read it so I could read it fresh now oh well I'll just reread it anyway'
And then in my fantasy Ao3 keysmashed fics would be logged in a separate bit of one's history so I could go back and leave comments on the bestest stories once I'd calmed the fuck down.
Which doesn't look to be happening any time soon, sorry, authors of the world!
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/60313.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"You know, if someone has a fever, and as a result they feel cold and they have rigors and shit, the way to make them stop feeling cold and having rigors is to bring their fever down, with the use of antipyretic medication, maybe antibiotics, if you want to go old school tepid sponging and so forth.
You know what does not bring a fever down? Extra fucking blankets!
It would have been such a lovely little h/c story otherwise.
And yes, yes I am procrastinating. What of it?

eta I'm pretty sure current research doesn't actually rate tepid sponging, but whatever, it's h/c fic, any excuse for nakedness and/or close quarters comfort is good, right? It's at worst useless, it certainly isn't going to push anyone's temperature up
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/60130.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."
event,"...for all the AO3 502 error messages.
It is because I am reading allllll the Avengers fic.
Well, all right, all the Clint/Phil fic first.

And attempting to write, which is for the first time in a long time which feels pretty nice, except I'm pretty sure nothing I write could ever be as good as some of this stuff and so why not just read instead.
Might take a look at the avengers reversebang later this month to see if there's anything that grabs me, but I worry a bit about my total failure to finish anything lately.
I don't worry enough to leechblock AO3 or anything, don't get me wrong. It's more a kind of resigned 'oh well'.
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/59812.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."
event,"Mostly <lj-cut text=""cut for people with no interest in my spawn"">
New baby with besotted older brother! Who is 3!!! 3!!! How on earth is that possible???

And very little writing, so in lieu of actually finishing anything now that the baby is sleeping, I figured I would do the top ten on the AO3 meme, because I've been enjoying reading everyone else's posts on it, and because I wish I had done it last year so I could see any changes.

First-season Arthur/Merlin with protective Arthur and injured-but-trying-to-be-stoic Merlin. This fic appeared in my head more or less fully formed and was written quickly for <lj user=""merlin_flashfic"">'s knee-walking challenge. I remain pretty proud of it tbh, the Arthur in it is the Arthur I fell in love with - emotionally repressed but fundamentally decent - he'll be showing up a few times on this list!

This was written for a commentfic meme on <lj user=""gyzym"">'s LJ and was a quick bit of fluff. I think its high placement is because it was posted to AO3 at the same time as anywhere else. I know if I have a choice of where to read I will choose AO3. I'm still kind of surprised it's at number 2 though. I am a very naughty casspeach and didn't link to the prompt anywhere I can easily find, but it was to do with civil unions being signed into Hawaii law, so yeah, fluff. OTOH I like fluff both to write and to read :-)
3) Making a Living Out of Hope 2374 hits; 31 kudos

Star Trek AOS BigBang. AU McCoy/Chekov and just taking the crown for longest fic on the list at 37,057 words, rated E, warnings for onscreen unwitting dubcon and offscreen non-con, and violence (pretty mildly described because I am a wuss)

Maybe the length makes this popular on AO3? It's by no means a popular pairing, I don't think, whereas most of the other fics in my top ten have been the fandom OTP. Maybe the idea of McCoy rescuing an enslaved Chekov is just too irresistible??
4) By Strength and by Virtue 1865 hits; 29 kudos
Arthur/Merlin, AU, rated E, warning for dubcon.

The rusalka story, being an example of the something made them do it trope which is my favourite. I'm pretty happy with how this one turned out too. I experimented a bit with a slow reveal and less linear storytelling than I usually do, and I think it worked well.
Although I frequently get asked what the farriery references are all about, which...I kinda think must make the thing incomprehensible.
Steve/Danny, H50, rated T, warning for medical stuff

Written for <lj user=""kissemdanno""> and another slightly experimental fic (note this is experimental for me, to massively experimental. I tend to write pretty linear stories!). I enjoyed writing this one a lot, with its fairytale tropes and established relationship Steve/Danny with amicable ex-wife!Rachel. {sigh} written before my breakup with H50 in other words.

Written for a <lj user=""kinkme_merlin""> prompt that I am sure was after something a lot darker than I wrote, and featuring fundamentally-decent!Arthur and the Merlin I wish we saw more of on page and screen. Arthur conquers Ealdor and claims Merlin as a Spoil basically. This was a lot of fun to write too (which seems to be a recurring theme, clearly my struggles to write are apparent when they occur and poison my writing or something - and yes I am totally using this hypothesis as an excuse to abandon anything that starts to feel remotely difficult in future!), especially the weaving in of bits of canon. I really wanted to write more in this verse, but I was intimidated by all the people asking me to do so! True, and rather tragic, story.
Written for for , this one features another of my favourite tropes:fuck or die/bonding. I can't quite decide which one fits best.

So maybe McCoy/Chekov are a little more popular than I thought. I wish I'd had more time to write this one, because, as is often the case with my stories, I think the beginning is much stronger than the end.
Arthur/Merlin and Bradley/Colin, BBC Merlin and BBC Merlin RPF, rated E

Another <lj user=""kinkme_merlin""> kinkmeme-inspired fic with the awesome idea of reincarnation fic where Bradley is Merlin and Colin is Arthur reincarnated. Great fun to write, if a little difficult to keep it from being a bit headfucky and confusing to start with.

I think of this as my first long fic, because it was the first fic I wrote as a long fic, and not as a WiP in installments (yeah, I know, I used to do that, despite my utter hopelessness at finishing stuff once I get distracted by new shiny). Written for 's Harlequin challenge. I wrote my arse off to get this done in time. It was kind of a proto-NaNoWriMo experience for me. Possibly more popular than Obeisance, but posted on my own website first (a website I set up just to post this on!) which has no hit counter so who knows. The only story I have ever written where the summary came easily to me. First posted in 2005, this is the oldest story in my top ten.
Neville/Draco, Harry Potter, AU, rated E
The only story featuring my only OTP. I wish this wasn't such a rare pairing, because they are made for each other, dammit!!

Written for <lj user=""svmadelyn"">'s undermistletoe challenge, and the second-longest fic on the list at 35,326 words. There are some issues with this, and I maybe wouldn't have written it now, but I still love it anyway, because we Draco/Neville shippers have to take what we can find, even if it's our own fic!

- I owe a lot of the hits on these stories to recs, I think. Most of them have been recced somewhere visible or by someone prominent, for which I am immensely grateful and proud. Also to posting them to prominent communities, or as part of challenges. In fact all of the stories in my top ten were flashfics, kinkmeme responses, challenge fics or fic-exchanges.
- I love the AO3 as a reader and as a writer.
- I love comments but go through phases of being really really terrible at responding to them, although I do try to respond to them all eventually.
- I also love kudos, both as a reader although I do sometimes feel terrible guilt about not commenting, and as a writer.
- I hope other people continue to do this meme, and to ponder their results. It's been really interesting to read them.</lj-cut>
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/59447.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"The last few weeks have been a bit sucky for me, tbh. I've been diagnosed with gestational diabetes and had a bit of a pregnancy BP scare, had to have a week off work sick, which is unheard of, and couldn't even enjoy it because I felt so crook :-(
Feeling much better now but can't sit at my desk for too long at a time because my ankles swell up, and even if I could my motivation to write is about zero.

On the plus side I am very nesty, and getting lots of things uncluttered and sorted out in very short blocks of time, thanks to bitesizedcleaning and unfuckyourhabitat, and the baby seems to be doing just fine.
I'm keeping up with my dwcircle and flist, I just don't feel like I have anything of any interest to say.
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/59163.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"So, last night OH came home from work and said he heard something in the bushes...or someone ha ha ha, he's such a kidder, and I thought nothing of it and went to bed. But this morning I got up stupidly early to go to Tesco without the small boy and get a few things for Christmas baking (which was an experience in itself let me tell you. The place looked like it'd been ransacked - boxes and wrappings everywhere and about a billion shelf-stackers).
When I got back to the house I drive past our oil tank to see it has about 4 plastic barrels and a bit of hose sticking out of it because some arsehole has been siphoning off my oil.

Which means in addition to doing all the Christmas baking, preparing the house for visitors, wrapping the presents, and attending my work's Christmas lunch, I am probably also going to have to deal with some disinterested police and potentially have to try and find someone to fix my damn oil tank.
At least there's plenty of chocolate in the house!
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/59004.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"Sooo, back in the beginning of season 1 of H50 I was kind of madly fannishly in love with everyone on the show and especially Danny. It was wonderful, and during that time someone ([livejournal.com profile] shinystarlight you know who you are) Gave me the world's greatest plot bunny and I managed to bang out a little over 25k before the last two episodes of the season ruined the characterisation of Danny for me, and especially for this fic.
For a while I thought I might finish it, but given that I cannot even make myself watch the second season, I'm giving that idea up.
So, here, free to a good home if anyone wants to continue with it, is the robot!Steve fic.

It would have been the longest story I have ever written, on account of 25k in and I'm still setting up. It would eventually have ended up Steve/Danny, possibly unrequited and is rated R, I guess as is, although that's probably on the cautious side.
Link to 'Do Androids Surf Electromagnetic Waves?' on my DW account"

event,"1) I have voted in the OTW elections, and it feels like as much of an anticlimax as voting in RL elections does...I'm not sure what I want, but some kind of feeling of having taken part in a great moment of democracy which I do not find I get from walking out of a polling station or closing a firefox tab!
I am fully aware that this is a problem with me!

2) The road I live down - hello to the 2? people who have been here - is closed at the end nearest the main road while they widen a culvert that has been flooding every winter and spring for at last as long as I have lived here. The signs saying it would be closed went up about a month ago, and it is extremely well signposted from ages back. And yet we are still getting at least one vehicle an hour (please note I live in the middle of nowhere - this constitutes considerable traffic for my village!) bombing past the house and then reversing very slowly back up to the next field where they can turn around.
So yeah, people who don't think 'road closed' applies to them...That 'access only' thing is for my house, and the one just before, well, you know, the bit where they closed the road!!
I am fairly sure no one who drives down my road reads my journal, but I feel better for venting :-)
3) someone tell me I don't want to sign up for hurt/comfort bigbang...even though I totally do. The deadline for fics is a month after the baby is due.
And I promised I wasn't going to sign up for anything ever again, ooh, less than a week ago.
Which means I've held out longer than usual?
4) Just in case. I have totally not abandoned the x-men cowboy AU idea. I am just a bit magpie-ish in my love of shiny new things right now!
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/58336.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."
event,"And totally deserving its own post rather than going along with my other blethering.

I am so enormously grateful to everyone who works on the AO3 and fanlore and OTW and all the bits of the org that I never even see. It's so easy to forget the voluntary nature of all of it, and whatever its problems it has achieved great things already. The archive is awesome, and okay so I opened it post-recent deploy and went 'gaaaah my eyes!' but I know that this is mostly because I am change-averse in these things. I went so far as to complain to the BBC about the bbc news website when it changed, and now I get the 'gaaaah my eyes!' response when I inadvertently end up on an old page.

I know there were bugs, but the speed at which things have been fixed, both by volunteers and by people just willing to help out fellow fans by sharing their own skills is surely part of what the joy of fandom is about. That whole socialist 'from each according to her ability to each according to her need' thing.
Um, wow okay that got off topic. Basically I <3 fandom was the point of that.
And I don't doubt that everyone involved was doing their best and hardest work and I am grateful for it.

I would hate to see anyone else fall on their sword because of system problems in the organisation, because the more I read the more apparent it becomes that that is most likely what is going on here.
So basically coders, wranglers, supporters, abuse people, staffers, volunteers and everyone else I've forgotten about:
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/57884.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"I've been putting off posting for ages because I seemed to mostly have moaning stuff to say, almost all of which was 'why can't I write mooooore?' and I was aware that posting was basically yet another way of procrastinating.

And it was stupid anyway because I already know the answer to the question, and it is my usual laziness coupled with the fact that I am having another baby! Due at the end of March. And the exhaustion of early pregnancy in addition to that of entertaining the perpetual motion machine that is my almost-three year old has meant I sometimes have been going to bed before said toddler.

I'm finally out of the awful awful awful fatigue stage (and I've done 4-day-weekend shifts and worked 100+hr weeks, I know fatigue) and am left with what I remember from my first pregnancy (and was warned about by a close friend the first time): utter vocabulary failure. The stories are all in my head, but will they bastard well come out? Will they buggery.

So, I struggled and finally managed to scrape out a story for Interhouse fest which I signed up for in a fit of enthusiasm and then promptly forgot all about besides a vague feeling that the deadline was the end of November (which it wasn't, it was October - yay!pregnancy brain). Thanks to my wonderful beta and cheerleader, montanaharper, I got it sent in just in time (missing half the header because again, pregnancy brain, I don't even care about all the studies that say it doesn't exist. It totally does). And then was on a weird kind of post-posting high but without the need to obsessively check my email because Interhouse fest is an anonymous challenge and the mods are going to post it when they do. Also it's [redacted rareslash pairing] on what appears to be a largely het challenge, so it's not like I'm going to be deluged anyway.
I have therefore conceded defeat on NaNo without even opening a document to write in.

I've also used the time to write my user page on fanlore finally, after a mere 15 months of promising myself I'd get around to it. Turns out having to actually think about my fannish activities has revealed that I am rather more fannish than I originally thought. Next up, try and remember/find out exactly how many Hornblower cons I actually went to, correct the info in my page and maybe write a bit about them.

I've also been reading a lot of the stuff around the OTW elections. I think it's been very useful to see more of what's going on within the organisation. There is a tendency I think to assume things are fine if you never hear any different and I'm saddened to hear sme of the stories of burnout.

I don't have much time, skills (or brains at the moment) to really volunteer for anything, but I donate whenever asked, and I care a lot about the organisation. The AO3 is what I use the most. I think it's as good an archive as any I've ever read or posted to, but I don't want it to be the be all and end all of the org. To my mind the reason for the archive was to give us a safe space where we could be sure no one was going to take their toys home or bow to external pressure to regulate what was posted. The archive for me, is a symbol of what the org stands for, not the whole thing. By the fans for the fans, safe and collaborative, inclusive and welcoming. I really hope that all the discussions going on at the moment can help it become closer to that ideal.

It has also made me feel that I should be trying to find a volunteer space where I can be useful, and my first tiny step towards that is to contribute to fanlore instead of merely being grateful that other people do.
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/57786.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."

event,"So, I'm in the US, and have been for almost three weeks. We are leaving tomorrow. We came over for a long holiday because my other half is between jobs - he starts a new, and hopefully final, one next week, and I've been in my job long enough to get extra holiday this year. That in itself is kind of terrifying. When I took the job they said 'you'll get your sabbatical in 2011' and I was all 'ahahaha, I can't think seven months ahead, no way can I imagine still being here in seven years'

While we were here, we got married, in Vegas. No Elvis impersonator (which seems to be the most popular question from everyone we've told!) just a blissfully short ceremony at which our two-year old was made incredibly welcome - he drove his toy car down the aisle before us, and then around the chapel during the rest. It was honestly fun, and the least stressful wedding I have ever been to, I think. Which I totally wasn't expecting to say about my own.

Then we hired an RV and drove around mostly Utah. We visited Zion national park, Capitol reef national park, canyonlands, arches and dead horse point, finishing up with a trip on the train to the grand canyon. Turns out we went over our mileage allowance which surprised me, because we didnt do any crazy long drives or anything. When I get home I might bore everyone with photos. Suffice to say it was really cool trip, and great for the toddler to have both of our undivided attentions for three weeks. Not sure if that's what has turned him into a bit of a monster, or if it's just his age. Still soon he will be back with his childminder who will no doubt remind him quite easily that he is not quite as central to the universe as he currently seems to think!

And now we are in a very nice hotel decompressing until we fly home tomorrow. I think we have had maybe one day when the toddler has not been swimming. Returning to boring old England is going to be something of a shock.
Things I am looking forward to getting back to -
1) proper Internet, and being able to write on a proper keyboard at a proper desk again.
2) Tea! I took my own teabags because I knew three weeks with no decent tea would not be pretty, but the water's never quite hot enough and the milk isn't quite right and just yeah, tea.
Unsurprisingly the trip has reawakened my not especially dormant love of cowboys. But hey, at least I now have an idea for my xmen big bang. I just hope I have enough time to write it.
Obviously I have not yet seen Dr Who. I think I probably better not check my flist/circle until I have, seeing as I've already nearly spoiled myself three times!
This entry was originally posted at http://casspeach.dreamwidth.org/56892.html. Please comment here or there or using OpenID."
